title: Honoring Vincent S. Auletta, Sr. upon the occasion of his designation as Veteran of the Year by the Kingston Veterans Association
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring Vincent S. Auletta, Sr. upon the occa-
sion of his designation as Veteran of the Year by the Kingston  Veterans
Association

WHEREAS,  Members  of the Armed Services from the State of New York, who
have served so valiantly and honorably in wars in  which  this  county's
freedom  was at stake, as well as in the preservation of peace in peace-
time, deserve a special salute from this Legislative Body; and
  WHEREAS, The dedication  and  sacrifices  of  our  military  personnel
ensure  our  continued  role  as  a  Nation which embodies the ideals of
democracy, and is a defender  of  liberty  for  peoples  throughout  the
world; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body  is  justly  proud  to  honor
Vincent  S. Auletta, Sr. upon the occasion of his designation as Veteran
of the Year by the Kingston Veterans Association  on  Sunday,  September
26, 2010; and
  WHEREAS,  A  Cold  War submariner and three-time commander of Kingston
Post 150 American Legion, Vincent Auletta has been chosen  as  the  22nd
Kingston Veteran's Association Veteran of the Year; and
  WHEREAS,  From 1974-1980, Vince Auletta made five cruises on a nuclear
submarine stationed in Groton and  Scotland;  he  was  discharged  as  a
second class petty officer interior communications electrician; and
  WHEREAS,  As a veteran, Vincent Auletta reorganized the Post 150 Color
Guard and is a member of the VFW Post 1386 Color Guard and a former post
adjutant; he is also affiliated with the Knights of  Columbus,  Kingston
Elks,  and  the  Hudson-Mohawk  chapter  of  the United States Submarine
Service; and
  WHEREAS, A retired manager at  Verizon,  Vincent  Auletta  is  a  life
member of the VFW and the American Legion; and
  WHEREAS,  With  him  throughout  have been his wife, Wanda, their five
children, as well as three grandchildren, all of whom feel privileged to
be a part of his life and rejoice in his achievements; and
  WHEREAS, A consummate leader, Vincent Auletta has provided  unwavering
guidance both within Veterans organizations and his community; and
  WHEREAS,  Having  exhibited  his  patriotism  both at home and abroad,
Vincent S. Auletta, Sr. has demonstrated his love for  his  country  and
merits forevermore the highest respect of this State and Nation; and
  WHEREAS,  This  Legislative Body is very pleased to have this opportu-
nity to express its gratitude to the men and women of the United  States
Armed Forces for their tremendous sacrifices made for our Nation and for
the benefit of all Americans; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Vincent S. Auletta, Sr. upon the occasion of  his  designation  as
Veteran  of  the  Year  by  the Kingston Veterans Association; and be it
further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Vincent S. Auletta, Sr.
